rComments: He is such an incredible professor! Honestly, one of the best and sincerely cares about his students. The class is hard but he prepares you for grad school.

Great professor personality wise. However, he cannot effectively teach. Office hours are somewhat helpful, but one-on-one is better. Read the book or watch YouTube videos PRIOR to class. Do ALL the extra credit. It made my grade go a letter up! His tests are free-response, so UNDERSTAND. Do NOT memorize!

Rexach is a very enthusiastic professor when teaching BIOL20A. His class is no joke, the exams are all free response and you're expected to be able to answer very broad questions with very specific answers. If you want to survive in his class you really need to read the book and understand the material. DON'T GET BEHIND, YOU WILL REGRET IT.

Rexach isn't a bad professor, but his style is incredibly unforgiving towards average students. Do NOT take this class if you struggle with tests! 100% of your grade is from just 3 tests, all short answer (no multiple choice). He isn't the clearest speaker but encourages students to call him out when he makes mistakes and it usually goes okay.

Rexach is overall a pretty good professor. Although I had him for 20A and did not appreciate him, he is amazing in 110! Test are tough but he curves like crazy, definitely possible to get an A in his class. Take advantage of the extra credit, if you don't you WILL regret it! Also don't expect to be handed the grade, must work for it, look at slides
Great Teacher! Best Ive ever had, I had him for 20A as well. He allows you to get 20 extra credit points. On top of this, 92/100 pts. is an A+.

Rexach was a great professor! The exams were tough but if you studied the slides, and watched over the webcast you'd do great, also don't forget to do the study guides they were also helpful especially for the extra credit quizzes in discussion section. The final was not comprehensive which was great, less stress for finals week.

Cell Biology is difficult in general no matter who you take it with. Rexach is super enthusiastic and funny! In order to do well in this class, WATCH THOSE WEBCASTS. Also, reviewing the lecture slides, study guide questions and previous exams were helpful due to the tests being all free response. ALSO THERE IS EXTRA CREDIT TAKE ADVANTAGE OF THAT!
Don't take this class.

Rexach is the best professor I had in UCSC. I did not get an A in his class because I hardly went to class, but that was my fault. I'm glad I had him for Cell Bio and wished I took 20A with him too. He has a flexible grading system, and he even offers 10 points worth of extra credit. I recommend this professor if you plan to take Cell Bio

Rexach is a very tough professor, but he is one of the best professors I have ever had. He knows his material very well and is very passionate about his research. His lectures are all you need for the tests. I only used the book for clarification. This class requires a lot of hard work and effort but he is nonetheless an amazing professor.
Rexach was one of the best professors I've had at UCSC. He really cares about the students and he's very very reasonable.

Professor Rexach is the best professor I have ever taken in UCSC. He's so motivated to teach  and he's always willing to help and make you understand the concepts. His exams are straight-forward and if you studied you would do exceptionally well in the class.

Rexach is the most intelligent professor I have ever come across at UCSC. He is tough because he knows the subject very well and is very passionate about his research. His class is webcasted for a reason! Watch those videos and make sure to listentakes notes of what he says! He is very knowledgeable but his tests are essay questions so study!

his test are hard broad questions and he looks for specific answers so its hard to get the points you actually deserve but if you go to his office hours or talk to him  its so clear what he expects from you hell sit down and talk for hours with you about the class or how to help you in your future career. inspirational, just do the work he is clear

His exams are the worst I have ever taken. He wants a detailed answer that requires a very specific wording of his peference to a very vague and confusing question. His lectures are long and his office hours are enjoyable but not very helpful. He did give extra credit in section but the answers also required specific wording. Just don't take this.

This class was a joke. He told the students that if were doing poorly in the class, that maybe we should reconsider our majors. uhm no. Maybe we are doing poorly because his tests are ridiculously specific and vague but he expects the exact sentence out of the booklecture to get  .0140 points. Avoid at all costs.

Professor Rexach is by far the worst professor I've ever had. He is extremely hard to understand and his test questions are so vague, yet he expects a specific answer (sometimes not even addressed in the question). I wanted and needed to take bio for my major and I absolutely hated this class. Maybe he is a smart man, but he is a horrible teacher.

If you absolutely have to take him, take him. Like all the other posts, he is extremely vague in his questions for the exams with a specific answer in mind even if the question has two or more answers. For the most part I had to self study and memorize the terms even if he said there will be no memorization. Pls, do not take himl, go else where.
He's grading style is non-sense! He does not believe in "memorizing" but yet all examinations are free response. I strongly suggest to avoid him! I have not learn anything from his lectures!

Do not take this class if you want a good understanding of biology. His tests are tricky, but for all the wrong reasons. The wording of his questions is extremely unclear. His lectures are not helpful at all, but people attend out of sheer hopelessness since there is nearly no guidance given on how to do better. I don't feel like I learned anything
Try to just avoid him..

Good, nice lecturer. Midterms are 3 questions, each has sub questions, answers are written. Graders look for specific answers to give you credit. Offers extra credit points for taking quizes in discussion class. He makes you work for it but its' rewarding and interesting material. I'd recommend taking it with him. I loved taking this class.

This is definitely one of the most challenging classes I've taken here. Midterms and finals we all assay question. Be prepared to spend at least 10 hrweek going over the slides. Two saving graces: 1. Extra credit quizzes. 2. Michael is actually a really awesome and kind prof once you get to know him and he's genuinely passionate about cell bio.

His tests are very difficult. Don't expect to just memorize things and hope to get an A. Lectures were really interesting and you could tell that he's very passionate and knowledgeable about cell bio. Very helpful and approachable. Tough class, great professor.

Very helpful, the key is to listen and write down every word he says in the webcast and print out the slides. He's clear about what you need to know, make sure you go to section for extra credit! He gives out 10% of extra credit over the quarter. Good professor, I learned a lot!

Rexach is a solid professor and the material is fascinating, just make sure you know the lectures (what he says verbally in addition to what's seen on the slides) inside and out to the finest of details. His exams are tough and are comprised entirely of essay questions. The examsmake you think hard about the material instead of blindly memorizing.
Big on the double standards...

Rexach is definitely not as bad as the previous reviews. He's a little bit hard to understand because of his accent, so make sure to watch the webcasts.  Once you can understand him, he's very clear about what he expects you to know for the exams.

I came into this class dreading the thought of learning about cells. It didn't help with all the bad rep I was hearing about professor Rexach. But honestly, it's not that bad. As long as you put full effort into this class, and stay on top of the material you should be fine. He's a really nice teacher and willing to help you.

Excellent professor! Obviously, cell bio is not an easy class anywhere, but Rexach clearly explains all concepts. If you don't do well, it's your own fault because you didn't put in enough time.  Don't expect to just be handed an A for attending lecture

Worst teacher ever. Do not take him, he is so hard to understand because the way he talks and his lectures do not make sense at all. He doesn't seem to explain anything. I wish I could've took this class in the spring with a different teacher.

I had Rexach for Cell Bio and I can honestly say this was the worst professor I've had at Santa Cruz. As a professor, Rexach was really discouraging, unhelpful, condescending, and disingenuous. He liked to deride some of of his students and was not concerned at all about how they felt. Overall, avoid Rexach if at all possible!

Rexach is an amazing teacher! He teaches about all his work. Cell bio is a super hard class, but Rexach made it fun and interesting.  His tests were made directly from the slides, but it is the details that count.  Plan on studying a lot!

Cell Biology was a difficult enough on its own and Rexach did not make it any easier. His lectures were very general and became very boring. He isn't a good teacher and I felt like he didn't care about his students nor did he encouraged us. Don't take his class if you are able to avoid it!
extremely boring, had to rely on the book. super hard class, he makes it harder than it is, his tests are at graduate level and are graded extremely hard. dont take this class with rexach

His lab is interesting and he's good at teaching it.  He's also really nice..... to your face.  He'll tell you everything's good during the quarter, then straight reams you in your evaluation.  Gave quite a few of us the same criticisms, even though they contradicted what he would say to our faces.

the final was a lot easier than the midterm. it's all concept based.  the midterm was a little tricky and hard but if u go to his office hour, he'll be glady to help you. he's a nice professor. i basically had a low F on the midterm and a little above average on the final, he gave me a C+ for the class.  if u do well on the final,u'll pass .
